title: (x) New Releases - Clarendon {Jos� Mar�a Cerezo}
content:
Can anyone name this font - or a similar one?   
   
Thanks!   
   
 ![Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125331im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41009.gif)
author: henriko

comments.content:
Thanks Joseph!   
Is there a similar font in the Font Folio-collection perhaps??

Clarendon is very similar and it's more common.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/clarendon/light/testdrive.html?s=New+Releases&p=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125331/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/clarendon/light/testdrive.html?s=New%2BReleases&p=48)

I agree with Jos�. I think it's definitely Clarendon, but [this weight](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125331/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/clarendon/clarendon/testdrive.html?s=New%a0Releases&p=36), not Light.

Cool guys!   
It's just what I've been looking for!!   
   
Thanks to Jos� og Mark ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125331im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Oh well, I tried.... (and am still learning thanks to everyone here at Typophile).   
   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125331im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
All it takes is practice. And a total lack of a sense of proportion. :-)

_All it takes is practice. And a total lack of a sense of proportion._   
   
Thanks, Mark. I love the practice part. My passion for type just seems to keep growing and growing. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125331im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
